scan_linter_check.description: The "gs.log()", "gs.debug()", "console.log()", etc. statements can be used to write information to the system log, while the "gs.print()", etc. statements also sends it as output to the screen. It is generally used when debugging. Using "gs.log()", "gs.debug()", "console.log()", etc. statements on a production instance will pollute the system log, while it is never used as you do not perform debugging on a production instance.
scan_linter_check.name: Scripts should not contain debugging statements in production
scan_linter_check.resolution_details: The best practice is to remove (commented) debug statements from scripts or making them conditionally controlled by a property.
scan_linter_check.short_description: Scripts should not contain debugging statements in production
